intro: Cacalia erubescens, commonly known as the redflower bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental value. Cacalia erubescens prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders.
